title: Firefox prompts for primary password even when it has not been restarted
content: Recently Firefox seems to be prompting for the primary (master) password even when it has been running for a while and I have unlocked the password manager. This making me wonder if there is some malware that is trying to get my saved logins. [I don't see any unfamiliar addons/plugins.] The other possibility is that there is a setting that changed that relocks the password manager after a specified period, or if/when I lock the computer. But I can't find anything that looks like a match in about:config: There is a setting for security.password.lifetime, but I the only information on it is contradictory, and does not match what I experience. -Nath Rao
creator: nathrao

title: Primary password requested multiple times as of recently
content: Hi, as of a couple months ago, Firefox has started asking for the primary password multiple times. It used to only do it once when it syncs after startup. But now I sometimes get the popup for the primary password multiple times. I haven't figured out a way to reproduce since it seems to randomly pop up, even when I'm not actively doing something in the browser. I believe this started happening after an update but I can't pin down the actual onset of this problem so I'm not sure. Does anyone else experience the same thing?

title: javascript and script location
content:
in this page .. <meta charset="UTF-8"> <title>mystuff</title> <script> function logKey(e) { console.log("at logKey"); //console.log(e); //log.value = ${e.code}; } </script> <input type="text" id="inp" value="typehere">

<script> var inp = document.getElementById('inp'); var log = document.getElementById('log'); inp.onkeyup = logKey; console.log(inp); </script>

i get a console log error report saying that on line 16 'inp' is undefined. I am 84.5 and trying to learn how to generate and interact with a web page. i wrote my first program in 1960 and have extensive C# experience but web programming seems to be more about where things are placed rather than what they do. Yes, i have history off.

title: Want to permanently clear cache in firefox without going to settings
content: My main objective is to clear the cache permanently for the application which i am accessing using Firefox. The customer with whom i am working with requires a permanent solution to clear cahce without the effort of the user to access the settings and clear cache from there.I have found a solution to clear cache by setting FF as private browser. On doing so it is almost clearing the entire cache but there is still some residual cache left. The residual cache that is remaining is called "addons.mozilla.org". This is creating a lot of issues for me. Many user are complaining that there is still cache left and this is the one ("addons.mozilla.org"). The users dont want to go to settings and clear the cache by themselves, they are too busy to do so. Please provide me a permannent solution to clear the cache once and for all without the need to access the settings to clear cache. PLEASE HELP

creator: myforfor

title: Firefox drives the Shell Infrastructure Host crazy.
content:
I've recently started using Firefox again, because it's more comfortable and faster than Chrome for watching Amazon Prime Video.

However, troubling troubles began to appear today. When I start Firefox, the Shell Infrastructure Host runs out of control and the RAM usage always exceeds 60%. And this also affected the performance of video playback, causing slow loading and choppy videos. Furthermore, this did not change after exiting Firefox, so I had to reboot my PC to refresh this process after launching Firefox.

I did some research on this process. My first suspicion was malware disguised as this process. However, this program was in the right place and multiple virus scans did not detect anything. Also, this process never runs amok when using different browsers, only when using Firefox does this runaway occur.

The next thing I suspected was adblock. However, the adblock I use is the same as the one I use in Chrome, and I have never had any problems using this extension before.

I also suspected a corruption in the program. However, after repairing using the command prompt, the problem continued to occur.

There are very few similar reports using google, and as I am not a PC expert, I cannot come up with a solution.

Please help me.
creator: kissmyvis

title: bookmarks failing to update
content:
Dear Firefox Community

I’m a Mac user. I’ve been a happy Firefox user for about eight years or more, with few problems. The only main one has been the refusal of Firefox to update automatically, even though I’ve ticked the box in preferences for this to happen so I always have to update by restarting Firefox manually and downloading it again.

I’m currently using Firefox 78.8.0esr. It needs updating, and I’ve tried about six or seven times over the last 6 weeks (most recently to Firefox 90.0.2dmg). Every time I do this, however, Firefox loses memory of me - and all my bookmarks (you’ll understand that after eight years there are a few hundred of these) disappear. I’ve copied them in in various ways (most recently by importing my Firefox bookmarks from 78.8.0 into Safari and then into Firefox 90 - and it works for about 12 hours or so, but then on the second or third time I open it reverts to the bookmarkless screen as if I’m a completely new user (with a really irritating picture of Soraya who is a Firefox fan and presumably is exempt the kind of problems I’m having).

Can you explain what is happening please, and how I can overcome this?

Thanks,

Steve Charters

title: HTML for two monitors
content:
--First will describe what I wanted to do, obstacles I faced, then list How I got around them. I wanted a two monitor transaction. One for person sitting at the PC and another for the audience to see. I found there may be something in the works to allow html to do that, but don't think it is implemented yet. If there is a way, please tell me. --First try was to open a second window and drag it to the other monitor. Minor problem, that was considered a popup, but was allowed to OK it. I intended to use parent/child window communication but the two windows weren't from the same 'domain' (come now - they were from the same directory). Hmm, the popup problem may be due to where I do the open (just found a demo that did not have a problem from a <a> or <input type=button> --Second try, I switched to postMessage() communication. That ran into problems when I coded (roughly) <button onclick="Send_Message('1 ',+FontSizeO.value+', '+x3+', '+x4+', '+x5)">Pause Clock</button> Only two parameters were being passed to Send_message - FontSizeO.value+', '+x3+', '+x4+', '+x5 was being sent a a single string as the second parameter to the function. I used the following code to fix that problem: function Send_Message() { X= arguments.join(',');Z=Z.split(','); SubWin.postMessage(Z,"*") } Later I changed the button to <button onclick="Start_Clock()">Start Clock</button>
coding the function call outside the onclick worked --Next problem was the <audio> wasn't being heard from the 'popup' window. I got around that by using a postMessage to the parent window to play the <audio> (also). It seems like an unecessary . --Recap, while I got around the problems, I would still like help for the following issues: 1) Coding HTML for two monitors. 2) Allowing parent/child window communication with widows generated from same directory (Yes, I know if I moved code to a server that shouldn't be an issue). A config parameter would do. 3) Need to fix problem with <button onclick="....">not passing more than two parameters to a called function. 4) Sound from the 'popup' window.
creator: Col_Boogie

title: Performance-Updates
content:
We know that maybe some think it is in the best interest of users to remove options, but removing the option to stop update notifications is compounding the basic problems of crashing, slowness, seemingly doing something in the background. First I would say that in the past I would use FF over all other browsers, but something happened in the past year that is making it unproductive to use the browser. Particularly when you lose setting and passwords saved.

Is there a way to stop notifications?

As a professional that has important work to do, I am considering removing the FF browser from the computer.
